knimeNode.name: GroupBy
knimeNode.shortDescription: Groups the table by the selected column(s) and aggregates the remaining columns using the selected aggregation method.

intro.p: Groups the rows of a table by the unique values in the selected columns. A row is created for each unique value group of the selected column(s). The remaining rows are aggregated by the defined method. The output table therefore contains one row for each existing value combination of the selected group column(s).
To change the aggregation method of more than one column select all columns to change, open the context menu with a right mouse click and select the aggregation method to use.

Available aggregation methods:
First: Takes the first entry per group.
First value: Takes the first value that is not a missing value per group.
Last: Takes the last entry per group.
Last value: Takes the last value that is not a missing value per group.
Mode: Takes the value with the most occurrences per group. If multiple values match this criterion the first occurrence is written to the output table.
Concatenate: Concatenates the values per group.
Unique concatenate: Concatenates each value only once per group.
Unique concatenate with count: Concatenates each value only once with the number of its occurrences per group.
Unique count: Counts each value only once per group.
Count: Counts members per group.
List: Creates a ListCell that contains all elements per group (including missing values).
Set: Creates a ListCell that contains each element only once per group (including missing values).
Additional aggregation methods only available for numerical columns:
Minimum: Calculates the minimum value per group.
Maximum: Calculates the maximum value per group.
Mean: Calculates the mean value per group.
Sum: Calculates the sum per group.
Variance: Calculates the variance per group.
Standard deviation: Calculates the standard deviation per group.
If the 'Sort in memory' option is checked the complete table is loaded into the memory to speed up the sorting process.

fullDescription.option: Select one or more column(s) according to which the group(s) is/are created.

Select one or more column(s) for aggregation from the available columns list. Change the aggregation method in the Aggregation column of the table. You can add the same column multiple times. In order to change the aggregation method of more than one column select all columns to change, open the context menu with a right mouse click and select the aggregation method to use.

Defines the maximum number of unique values per group to avoid problems with memory overloading. All groups with more unique values are skipped during the calculation and a missing value is set in the corresponding column, and a warning is displayed.
If enabled, the hiliting of a group row will hilite all rows of this group in other views. Depending of the number of rows, enabling this feature might consume a lot of memory.
Performs necessary sorting in the memory. Speeds up the process but consumes much more memory.
The name of the resulting aggregation column(s) depends on the selected naming schema.

ports.outPort: Result table with one row for each existing value combination of the selected columns.
